column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: enslaved. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```rdf@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .@prefix : <http://example.com/> .# Class Definitions:Enslaved    a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:comment "A person who is the legal property of another and is forced to obey them."@en ;    rdfs:label "Enslaved"@en .:SlaveOwner    a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:comment "A person who owns one or more slaves."@en ;    rdfs:label "Slave owner"@en .# Property Definitions:isEnslavedBy    a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Enslaved ;    rdfs:range :SlaveOwner ;    rdfs:comment "The relation between a slave and the person that owns them."@en ;    rdfs:label "is enslaved by"@en .:ownsSlave    a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :SlaveOwner ;    rdfs:range :Enslaved ;    rdfs:comment "The relation between a slave owner and the person they own as a slave."@en ;    rdfs:label "owns slave"@en .# Individual Definitions:John    a :Enslaved ;    :isEnslavedBy :MrSmith .:MrSmith    a :SlaveOwner ;    :ownsSlave :John .```In this ontology model, 2 classes have been defined: 'Enslaved' and 'SlaveOwner'. Two properties linking these classes are 'isEnslavedBy' and 'ownsSlave'. Then, individuals named 'John' and 'MrSmith' are created as instances of these classes. The property assertions state that John is enslaved by Mr. Smith, and Mr. Smith owns John as a slave.
